ul.li1: 1Woe is me! For I have become
ul.li2: like the gatherings of summer,
like the gleanings of the grape harvest,
ul.li1: when there is no cluster of grapes to eat
ul.li2: or early ripened fruit that my soul desires.
ul.li1: 2The faithful person has perished from the land,
ul.li2: and there is none who is upright among humankind.
ul.li1: All of them lie in wait;
ul.li2: each hunts his brother with a net.
ul.li1: 3Their hands are upon evil, to do it well;
ul.li2: the official and the judge ask for the bribe,
ul.li1: and the great man utters the evil desire of his soul;
ul.li2: and they weave it together.
ul.li1: 4The best of them is like a brier;
ul.li2: the most upright worse than a thorn hedge.
ul.li1: The day of your watchman, your punishment, has come;
ul.li2: now their confusion will come.
ul.li1: 5Do not put faith in a friend;
ul.li2: put no trust in a close friend.
ul.li1: Guard the doorways of your mouth
ul.li2: from the one who lies in your lap.
ul.li1: 6For a son treats a father with contempt;
ul.li2: a daughter rises up against her mother,
ul.li1: a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;
ul.li2: the enemies of a man are the men of his own house.
ul.li1: 7But as for me, I will look to Yahweh;
ul.li2: I will wait for the God of my salvation.
My God will hear me.
ul.li1: 8You should not rejoice over me, O my enemy!
ul.li2: When I fall I will stand up;
ul.li1: when I sit in darkness
ul.li2: Yahweh will be a light for me.
ul.li1: 9I will bear the rage of Yahweh,
ul.li2: for I have sinned against him,
ul.li1: until he pleads my cause
ul.li2: and executes my justice.
ul.li1: He will bring me out to the light;
ul.li2: I will see his righteousness.
ul.li1: 10Then my enemy will see,
ul.li2: and shame will cover her who said to me,
ul.li1: “Where is Yahweh your God?”
ul.li2: My eyes will look upon her;
ul.li1: now she will become a trampling place,
ul.li2: like mud in the streets.
ul.li1: 11A day for building your walls;
ul.li2: on that day he will extend your boundary.
ul.li1: 12On that day he will come to you
ul.li2: from Assyria and the cities of Egypt,
ul.li1: and from Egypt to the River,
ul.li2: and from sea to sea
and mountain to mountain.
ul.li1: 13But the earth will be a desolation
ul.li2: because of its inhabitants,
for the fruit of their deeds.
ul.li1: 14Shepherd your people with your staff,
ul.li2: the flock of your inheritance,
ul.li1: those dwelling alone in a forest
ul.li2: in the midst of Carmel.
ul.li1: Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead,
ul.li2: as in the days of old.
ul.li1: 15As in the days when you came out
ul.li2: from the land of Egypt
I will show him wondrous things.
ul.li1: 16The nations will see and be ashamed
ul.li2: because of all their might.
ul.li1: They will lay the hand on the mouth;
ul.li2: their ears will be deaf.
ul.li1: 17They will lick the dust like the serpent,
ul.li2: like the crawling things of the earth.
ul.li1: They will come trembling from their strongholds
ul.li2: to Yahweh our God.
Let them fear and be afraid of you.
ul.li1: 18Who is a God like you, forgiving sin
ul.li2: and passing over rebellion for the remnant of his inheritance?
ul.li1: He does not retain his anger forever,
ul.li2: for he delights in loyal love.
ul.li1: 19He will again have compassionLiterally “He will return, he will have compassion” on us;
ul.li2: he will trample our iniquities.
ul.li1: And you will hurl all their sins
ul.li2: in the depths of the sea.
ul.li1: 20You will show faithfulness to Jacob,
ul.li2: and loyal love to Abraham,
ul.li1: as you have sworn to our ancestorsOr “fathers”
ul.li2: from the days of old.
